intro: Serratula leucantha, commonly known as the white serretia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow florets arranged in a disc-like structure, surrounded by bracts. Serratula leucantha is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
